detailed_translations.chinese: （设法）做完；通过；设法联系上（尤指打通电话）
detailed_translations.english: If you get through a task or an amount of work, especially when it is difficult, you complete it

sentences.english: I'll ring back in half an hour.
sentences.chinese: 半小时内我给你回电话。

detailed_translations.english: If you ring someone back, you phone them either because they phoned you earlier and you were not there or because you did not finish an earlier telephone conversation

sentences.english: Don't ring off!
sentences.chinese: 不要挂断电话！

detailed_translations.english: When you ring off, you put down the receiver at the end of a telephone call

sentences.english: Is the coffee break the adult version of recess?
sentences.chinese: 工间喝咖啡是成人的休息方式吗？

detailed_translations.english: a way of explaining or doing something that is typical of a particular group or period of time

sentences.english: Typing is considered by most employers to be a basic competence.
sentences.chinese: 大多数雇主认为打字是一项基本技能。

detailed_translations.chinese: 能力，胜任；权限；作证能力；足以过舒适生活的收入
detailed_translations.english: the ability to do something well

name: competent
trans: 能胜任的；有能力的；称职的

sentences.english: A competent mechanic should be able to fix the problem.
sentences.chinese: 一名合格的机修工应该能够解决这个问题。

detailed_translations.english: having enough skill or knowledge to do something to a satisfactory standard

sentences.english: ...a U.S. Army Jeep.
sentences.chinese: …一辆美军吉普车。

detailed_translations.english: A Jeep is a type of car that can travel over rough ground

name: personnel
trans: 人力资源；人事部；全体人员

sentences.english: All personnel are to receive security badges.
sentences.chinese: 所有人员都将拿到安保徽章。

detailed_translations.english: the people who work in a company, organization, or military force
a king of Cyprus, who fell in love with the statue of a woman he had sculpted and which his prayers brought to life as Galatea

name: George Bernard Shaw
trans: 乔治•伯纳德•萧 （也译萧伯纳，英国剧作家）

sentences.english: The general population feels a connection to it and its popularity is best described by George Bernard Shaw when he said, "The problem with political jokes is that they get elected.
sentences.chinese: 普通大众感觉得到某种与政治的关联； 而其最为盛行的方面，乔治·萧伯纳描述得最好，他说：“问题是，他们总是与政治笑话一起当选。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 乔治•伯纳德•萧 （也译萧伯纳，英国剧作家）

sentences.english: Branagh won two awards for his screen adaptation of Shakespeare's Henry the Fifth.
sentences.chinese: 布拉纳因他对莎士比亚的《亨利五世》的荧幕改编而获了两次奖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 适应；改编；改编本，改写本
detailed_translations.english: a film or television programme that is based on a book or play

sentences.english: The Coca-Cola bottle is one of the classic designs of the last century.
sentences.chinese: 可口可乐瓶是上个世纪的经典设计之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 最优秀的，典型的，标准的；传统式样的，典雅的
detailed_translations.english: having all the features that are typical or expected of a particular thing or situation

detailed_translations.chinese: 文学名著， 经典作品， 杰作； 优秀的典范； 古典文学， 古典语文研究
detailed_translations.english: a book, play, or film that is important and has been admired for a long time

name: caption
trans: （图片上的）说明文字；（电视、电影）字幕；（杂志等文章的）标题；

sentences.english: The local paper featured me standing on a stepladder with a caption, "Wendy climbs the ladder to success."
sentences.chinese: 当地的报纸刊登了一幅我站在活梯上的特写，下面写着：“温迪登上了成功之梯。”

detailed_translations.english: words printed above or below a picture in a book or newspaper or on a television screen to explain what the picture is showing

sentences.english: a two-acre plot of land
sentences.chinese: 一块两英亩的土地

sentences.english: a vegetable plot
sentences.chinese: 一块菜地

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of land for building or growing things on
to make a secret plan to harm a person or organization, especially a political leader or government

sentences.english: The professor improvised a poem in the class.
sentences.chinese: 教授在课堂上即兴创作了一首诗。

sentences.english: The professor lambasted me for my careless mistake.
sentences.chinese: 教授严厉批评了我的粗心错误。

sentences.english: We were laughing about that absent-minded professor.
sentences.chinese: 我们都在笑那个心不在焉的教授。

sentences.english: Hey, this may be a way of getting rid of Dean Higgins.
sentences.chinese: 嘿，这可能是一个摆脱希金斯院长的一个方法。

sentences.english: He interpreted the role of Professor Higgins wonderfully.
sentences.chinese: 他非常出色地扮演了希金斯这个角色。

sentences.english: He is also, like Higgins, one of the coolest and most tenacious of competitors.
sentences.chinese: 如同希金斯一样，他也是最为优秀，最为顽强的选手之一。

sentences.english: Forensics includes many fields of science, including anthropology, biology, chemistry, engineering, genetics, medicine, pathology, phonetics, psychiatry, and toxicology.
sentences.chinese: 法医物证学涉及到多个科学领域，包括人类学、工程学、医药学、病理学、语音学、精神病学和毒理学。

sentences.english: Taking such refresher courses in Linguistics as phonetics, phonology, morphology, and etymology in Dept. of Japanese at Shanghai University of Foreign Languages (9/1992-7/1993).
sentences.chinese: 在上海外国语大学日语系进修语音学，音位学，形态学和词源学等语言学课程（1992年9月至1993年7月）。

sentences.english: Useful Courses for English-teaching include: Psychology, teaching methodology,phonetics, rhetoric, grammar, composition.
sentences.chinese: 对英语教学有用的课程包括：心理学、教学方法论、语音学、修辞学、语法、写作。

detailed_translations.english: the science and study of speech sounds

sentences.english: Nothing remained of the colonel.
sentences.chinese: 上校身后毫无遗物。

sentences.english: The captain jumped several grades and now was a colonel.
sentences.chinese: 这名上尉一连跳过了好几级，现在是上校了。

sentences.english: What if they go on to behave as murderously as the colonel and his paid killers?
sentences.chinese: 如果他们像他们的是上校和他的杀手们一样继续表现为杀气腾腾的又该怎么办？

detailed_translations.english: a high rank in the army, Marines, or the US air force, or someone who has this rank

sentences.english: “We are now at the beginning of the beginning” of a new relationship, Pickering said.
sentences.chinese: 皮克林说，我们现在处于两国新关系的“开端的开端”。

sentences.english: " Pickering agrees that the paper is "very important and original," adding that "it provides strong evidence that the neural coupling underlies the way that speakers come to understand each other.
sentences.chinese: 皮克林同意这篇论文“非常重要并且十分新颖”，他还补充说，“这项研究为奠定了交谈双方能够彼此理解的神经耦合提供了强有力的证据。”

name: fateful
trans: 重要的；决定性的；命中注定的

sentences.english: It was a fateful decision, one which was to break the Government.
sentences.chinese: 那是一项重大的决定，一个将使政府垮台的决定。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重大的；决定性的；宿命的
detailed_translations.english: having an important, especially bad, effect on future events

sentences.english: The lifeguard blew his whistle.
sentences.chinese: 救生员吹响哨子。

sentences.english: Adam whistled happily on his way to work.
sentences.chinese: 亚当在上班路上愉快地吹着口哨。

detailed_translations.english: a small object that produces a high whistling sound when you blow into it
to make a high or musical sound by blowing air out through your lips

sentences.english: She pulled the garment on and zipped it up.
sentences.chinese: 她穿上衣服并拉好拉链。

sentences.english: She works in the garment district of Manhattan.
sentences.chinese: 她在曼哈顿的服装加工区工作。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of clothing

sentences.english: a woollen scarf
sentences.chinese: 羊毛围巾

detailed_translations.english: made of wool

sentences.english: I hesitate.
sentences.chinese: 我犹豫。

detailed_translations.english: to be slow to speak or act because you feel uncertain or nervous

name: uncomfortable
trans: 不舒服的；不安的；不自在的

sentences.english: This sofa is so uncomfortable.
sentences.chinese: 这张沙发太不舒服了。

detailed_translations.english: not feeling physically comfortable, or not making you feel comfortable

sentences.english: I sat uncomfortably in my superseat for the rest of the journey feeling like a rotten heel.
sentences.chinese: 在余下的旅程中，我浑身不自在地坐在我的“特等座”上，觉得自己差劲透了。

sentences.english: The wire meshscreen symbolizes the isolation And I know it still hovers out there in the periphery of my vision uncomfortably close despite the many successes I have amassed.
sentences.chinese: 这个钢丝窗代表了隔离。 尽管我已经积聚了许多成功，但是我知道它仍然在我的视线边缘徘徊，非常近，令人不舒服。

name: troublesome
trans: 带来麻烦的；使人心烦的

sentences.english: The economy has become a troublesome issue for the Conservative Party.
sentences.chinese: 经济状况已成为保守党的一大难题。

detailed_translations.english: A troublesome situation or issue is full of complicated problems or difficulties.

sentences.english: He took a credit card out of his wallet.
sentences.chinese: 他从钱包里拿出一张信用卡。

detailed_translations.english: a small flat case, often made of leather, that you carry in your pocket, for holding paper money, bank cards etc

sentences.english: People who had heard the evidence at the trial were surprised at the outcome.
sentences.chinese: 在审判过程中听过证词的人都对此结果感到吃惊。

detailed_translations.english: the final result of a meeting, discussion, war etc – used especially when no one knows what it will be until it actually happens

sentences.english: Thieves broke into the offices and stole $150,000’s worth of computer equipment.
sentences.chinese: 小偷破门进入办公室，偷走了价值15万美元的电脑设备。

sentences.english: They were nothing but petty thieves (= thieves who steal small things ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们只不过是小毛贼。

detailed_translations.english: someone who steals things from another person or place

sentences.english: He flicked at spot with handkerchief.
sentences.chinese: 他轻轻地用手帕拂拭污点。

sentences.english: She waved away his offer of the handkerchief.
sentences.chinese: 她挥手拒绝了他递过来的手帕。

sentences.english: Before sweeping the house she bound up her hair in a large handkerchief.
sentences.chinese: 打扫房屋前， 她把头发用一块大手帕扎起来。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of cloth that you use for drying your nose or eyes

sentences.english: He made no attempt to disguise his agitation.
sentences.chinese: 他无意掩饰他的不安。

sentences.english: He is a master of disguise.
sentences.chinese: 他是伪装高手。

detailed_translations.english: to hide sth or change it, so that it cannot be recognized
the art of changing your appearance so that people do not recognize you

sentences.english: A challenge is simply an opportunity in disguise.
sentences.chinese: 一次挑战也就是一个被伪装的机会。

sentences.english: He is in disguise so none of his enemies will recognize him.
sentences.chinese: 他做了些伪装因此他的敌人谁都没有认出他来。

sentences.english: You can turn unemployment into a blessing in disguise – if you have the right mindset.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有一个良好的心态，你可以把失业转换成一种经过伪装的好事。

name: mistaken
trans: （见解或判断上）错误的；不正确的

sentences.english: It can’t have been my car. You must be mistaken.
sentences.chinese: 那不可能是我的车，你一定弄错了。

sentences.english: I thought he said 12 o’clock, but I might have been mistaken.
sentences.chinese: 我以为他说的是12点，但我有可能弄错了。

sentences.english: We bought the rug in Turkey, if I’m not mistaken .
sentences.chinese: 如果我没弄错的话，我们是在土耳其买的这块地毯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 错误的；弄错的；被误解的
detailed_translations.english: if you are mistaken, you are wrong about something that you thought you knew or saw

name: brilliant
trans: 才华横溢的；光辉灿烂的；杰出的

sentences.english: She closed her eyes against the brilliant light.
sentences.chinese: 强烈的光线下，她闭起了眼睛。

sentences.english: We sat outside in the brilliant sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 我们坐在外面，沐浴在灿烂的阳光下。

sentences.english: She was dressed in brilliant white.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着一身耀眼的白色。

sentences.english: The film was absolutely brilliant.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影极为出色。

detailed_translations.english: brilliant light or colour is very bright and strong

sentences.english: We’d classify Drabble’s novels under ‘Romance’.
sentences.chinese: 我们把德拉布尔的小说归类为“言情小说”。

sentences.english: Families are classified according to the father’s occupation.
sentences.chinese: 各个家庭按父亲的职业分类。

detailed_translations.english: to decide what group something belongs to

sentences.english: to make a remark
sentences.chinese: 发表评论

sentences.english: Critics remarked that the play was not original.
sentences.chinese: 评论家们指出这部戏剧缺乏创意

detailed_translations.english: something that you say when you express an opinion or say what you have noticed
to say or write a comment about sth/sb

sentences.english: He felt that she had betrayed him.
sentences.chinese: 他感觉她背叛了自己。

sentences.english: She had betrayed her parents' trust .
sentences.chinese: 她辜负了父母对她的信任。

sentences.english: I would never betray a confidence (=  tell a secret that someone has trusted me with  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我永远不会泄露秘密。

detailed_translations.chinese: 背叛， 出卖； 失信于， 辜负； 泄露； 暴露， 显露
detailed_translations.english: to be disloyal to someone who trusts you, so that they are harmed or upset

name: upper
trans: （位置或地位）较高的；级别较高的

sentences.english: the upper lip
sentences.chinese: 上唇

detailed_translations.english: in a higher position than something else

sentences.english: It took an extraordinary amount of work.
sentences.chinese: 这费了相当多的功夫。

sentences.english: It’s extraordinary that he should make exactly the same mistake again.
sentences.chinese: 真想不到他又犯了完全相同的错误。

sentences.english: The U.S. has called for an extraordinary emergency meeting of the UN Human Rights Commission to examine the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 美国已要求召开一次联合国人权委员特别紧急会议来调查这次危机。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非同寻常的；特别的（会议）
detailed_translations.english: very unusual or surprising

sentences.english: Politicians were quick to condemn the bombing.
sentences.chinese: 政治家们立即对爆炸事件进行了谴责。

sentences.english: He was found guilty and condemned to death.
sentences.chinese: 他被裁定有罪，判了死刑。

detailed_translations.english: to say very strongly that you do not approve of something or someone, especially because you think it is morally wrong

sentences.english: The gutters were blocked and overflowing.
sentences.chinese: 排水沟堵住了，水都溢出来了。

detailed_translations.english: the low part at the edge of a road where water collects and flows away

detailed_translations.chinese: 贫贱的；粗俗的；耸人听闻的

sentences.english: The brakes don’t seem to be working properly.
sentences.chinese: 刹车似乎不正常。

sentences.english: Then he’s not doing his job properly.
sentences.chinese: 那么他没把分内事做好。

sentences.english: Parents should teach their children to behave properly in public.
sentences.chinese: 家长应该教导子女在公共场合要有规有矩。

sentences.english: properly trained staff
sentences.chinese: 训练有素的员工

detailed_translations.english: correctly, or in a way that is considered right

sentences.english: the Duchess of York
sentences.chinese: 约克公爵夫人

detailed_translations.chinese: 公爵夫人；女公爵；雍容华贵的妇女；小老板娘
detailed_translations.english: a woman with the highest social rank outside the royal family, or the wife of a  duke

sentences.english: the US ambassador to Spain
sentences.chinese: 美国驻西班牙大使

detailed_translations.english: an important official who represents his or her government in a foreign country

sentences.english: She was a casual acquaintance of my family in Vienna.
sentences.chinese: 她是我们家在维也纳的一个交情不深的朋友。

sentences.english: They developed an acquaintance over the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 他们在因特网上相识。

sentences.english: The practice of a lawyer requires acquaintance with court procedures.
sentences.chinese: 当律师要熟悉法庭程序。

detailed_translations.english: someone you know, but who is not a close friend

sentences.english: The boy picked up a handful of stones and started throwing them at us.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩捡起一把石子，开始朝我们扔过来。

sentences.english: There were only a handful of people there.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：那里只有几个人。

detailed_translations.english: an amount that you can hold in your hand

sentences.english: I stared at her in amazement.
sentences.chinese: 我惊讶地盯着她。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of great surprise

sentences.english: They reacted with sighs of disappointment and stared in amazement at Hanna, who had more or less won the exchange.
sentences.chinese: 他们都发出了失望的叹息，惊讶地盯着汉娜，她或多或少赢得了些理解。

sentences.english: I had the good fortune to work with a brilliant head of department.
sentences.chinese: 我有幸与一位出色的部门主管共事。

sentences.english: Sickness or ill fortune could reduce you to a needy situation.
sentences.chinese: 疾病或厄运会让你穷困潦倒。

sentences.english: I felt it was useless to struggle against fortune.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得跟命运抗争是徒劳的。

detailed_translations.english: chance or luck, and the effect that it has on your life

name: authentic
trans: 真实的；真正的；可信的； 可靠的

sentences.english: an authentic account
sentences.chinese: 真实可信的说法

detailed_translations.chinese: 真的， 真正的； 可靠的， 可信的
detailed_translations.english: based on facts

sentences.english: Sure, I saw him but, generally speaking, drunks falling over are not my problem. Next time I see one I will do the same.
sentences.chinese: 我答道：“当然，我看见了他，但是一般而言，醉汉摔倒并不关我的事，下次遇到同样的事情我还是会像今天这么做的。”

sentences.english: These documents have no legal status in Britain.
sentences.chinese: 这些文件在英国并无法律效力。

sentences.english: What is your marital status (= are you married or not ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你的婚姻状况是什么？

detailed_translations.english: the official legal position or condition of a person, group, country etc

name: superior
trans: 更好的；职位[级别]更高的；上级的

sentences.english: She had that superior tone of voice.
sentences.chinese: 她带着那种傲慢的语气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 上级的，较高的；优越的；有优越感的，高傲的
detailed_translations.english: thinking that you are better than other people – used to show disapproval
someone who has a higher rank or position than you, especially in a job

sentences.english: I knew my parents would disapprove, but I went anyway.
sentences.chinese: 我知道父母会反对，但我还是去了。

sentences.english: Her family strongly disapproved of her behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 她的家人极不赞同她的行为。

detailed_translations.english: to think that someone or their behaviour, ideas etc are bad or wrong

sentences.english: They killed four policemen while robbing a bank.
sentences.chinese: 他们抢劫一家银行的时候杀了4名警察。

sentences.english: A 77-year-old woman was robbed at knifepoint.
sentences.chinese: 一名77岁老妪遭到持刀抢劫。

detailed_translations.english: to steal money or property from a person, bank etc

name: antique
trans: 古时的；（因古老、稀少而）珍贵的

sentences.english: an antique rosewood desk
sentences.chinese: 古董红木书桌

detailed_translations.chinese: 古老的，年代久远的；过时的，古董的；古风的，古式的
detailed_translations.english: antique furniture, jewellery etc is old and often valuable

detailed_translations.chinese: 古董，古玩；古风，古希腊和古罗马艺术风格
detailed_translations.english: a piece of furniture, jewellery etc that was made a very long time ago and is therefore valuable

sentences.english: a musical version of the fairy tale ‘Cinderella’
sentences.chinese: 童话故事《灰姑娘》的音乐剧版

sentences.english: When he began his musical career, King played only for black audiences.
sentences.chinese: 金在音乐事业的开始阶段只为黑人观众演奏。

detailed_translations.english: relating to music or consisting of music

sentences.english: I want you stuffed in my stocking.
sentences.chinese: 我只要你塞在我的袜子里。

sentences.english: The Christmas stocking bulged with goodies.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节袜子里塞满了好吃的东西。

sentences.english: She ran her silk stocking on a nail last night.
sentences.chinese: 她昨天夜晚丝袜被钉子钩住，抽了丝。

detailed_translations.english: a thin close-fitting piece of clothing that covers a woman’s leg and foot

sentences.english: I made no secret of the fact that I was not a believer.
sentences.chinese: 我对自己不是一个宗教信徒的事实并不隐瞒。

detailed_translations.english: someone who believes in a particular god, religion, or system of beliefs

sentences.english: Mr White has converted to Buddhism.
sentences.chinese: 怀特先生已改信佛教。

sentences.english: The custom derives its origin from Buddhism.
sentences.chinese: 这种习惯起源于佛教。

sentences.english: This concept is one of the fundamental doctrines in Buddhism and Hinduism.
sentences.chinese: 这一概念是佛教和印度教最基本的教义之一。

detailed_translations.english: a religion of east and central Asia, based on the teaching of Gautama Buddha

sentences.english: In this case, I genuinely believe in the Buddhist way of thinking.
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，我真诚地相信佛教徒的思维方式。

sentences.english: On the extreme northwestern outskirts of the city stands the Buddhist temple.
sentences.chinese: 那所佛教寺院位于市郊的最西北角。

sentences.english: These were all qualities he recognized in himself, but which all could be improved upon, and so he became a Buddhist.
sentences.chinese: 这些特质他都可以在自己的身上找到，但也都还有着可提高的空间，于是他成了一名佛教徒。

sentences.english: ...Buddhist monks.
sentences.chinese: …和尚。

detailed_translations.english: A Buddhist is a person whose religion is Buddhism
Buddhist means relating or referring to Buddhism

sentences.english: They knelt before the image of Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 他们在佛像面前下跪。

sentences.english: He has kept the figure of Buddha for luck.
sentences.chinese: 为了图吉利他一直保存着这尊佛像。

detailed_translations.english: Buddha is the title given to Gautama Siddhartha, the religious teacher and founder of Buddhism

sentences.english: But he could say vowel clearly and began to learn vocabulary.
sentences.chinese: 但是他已经能清楚地说元音并开始学习词汇。

sentences.english: Always end the name of your child with a vowel, so that when you yell the name will carry.
sentences.chinese: 一定让孩子的名字以元音结尾，这样当你喊叫时，这样的名字会助你一臂之力。

sentences.english: Towards the end of Middle English, a sudden and distinct change in pronunciation (the Great Vowel Shift) started, with vowels being pronounced shorter and shorter.
sentences.chinese: 随着中世纪英语的泯灭，发音突然发生了很大的变化（元音大推移），元音的发音越来越短。

detailed_translations.english: one of the human speech sounds that you make by letting your breath flow out without closing any part of your mouth or throat

sentences.english: "Rather like blood circulating in our veins, inside the termites nest it is air that is moved by external temperature and pressures," Pearce explained.
sentences.chinese: 皮尔斯说：“就象我们血管里的血液循环，在白蚁巢穴内部，空气随着外界的温度和压力而流动。

sentences.english: We've seen it all before with Stuart Pearce, Gareth Southgate and Chris Waddle, who've missed penalties and got the blame of the nation.
sentences.chinese: 我们以前也曾见过，斯图亚特皮尔斯，加雷斯索斯盖特以及克里斯·沃德尔，那么曾罚丢点球，受到国家的责备。

sentences.english: Jolie receives a secret note. She's to take a train from Paris to Venice, pick an average tourist and fool her pursuers into thinking that this stranger is Pearce.
sentences.chinese: 很快，朱莉收到了一张神秘的纸条，纸条上指示她搭上从巴黎到威尼斯的火车，在火车上选择一名普通的游客，伺机使监视者相信这个人就是皮尔斯。

sentences.english: a glass of milk and a cookie
sentences.chinese: 一杯牛奶和一块小甜饼

sentences.english: a chocolate chip cookie
sentences.chinese: 带巧克力碎粒的小甜饼

detailed_translations.english: a small flat sweet cake

sentences.english: She upped and threw the teapot at him.
sentences.chinese: 她跳起来，将茶壶向他掷去。

sentences.english: He once plugged up the spout of a teapot and placed it on the fire.
sentences.chinese: 曾有一次，他把茶壶嘴用东西堵住，然后把茶壶放在火炉上。

sentences.english: Sounds interesting.I just want to buy a teapot.
sentences.chinese: 听起来蛮有趣的。我刚好想买个茶壶。

detailed_translations.english: a container for making and serving tea, which has a handle and a  spout 1 1

sentences.english: fresh cream
sentences.chinese: 鲜奶油

sentences.english: strawberries and cream
sentences.chinese: 浇奶油的草莓

sentences.english: cream silk stockings
sentences.chinese: 乳白色的长筒丝袜

detailed_translations.english: a thick yellow-white liquid that rises to the top of milk

sentences.english: The key was hanging on a nail by the door.
sentences.chinese: 钥匙挂在门边的一颗钉子上。

sentences.english: Stop biting your nails!
sentences.chinese: 别咬指甲！

sentences.english: A sign saying ‘No Fishing’ had been nailed to the tree.
sentences.chinese: 树上钉着一块写有“禁止钓鱼”的牌子。

detailed_translations.english: a thin pointed piece of metal with a flat top, which you hit into a surface with a hammer, for example to join things together or to hang something on
to fasten something to something else with nails

sentences.english: wax crayons
sentences.chinese: 蜡笔

detailed_translations.english: a solid substance made of fat or oil and used to make candles, polish etc
to rub a layer of wax into a floor, surface etc to protect it or make it shine

sentences.english: Red blood cells are roughly the shape of a disk.
sentences.chinese: 红细胞大致呈圆盘状。

sentences.english: The program takes up 2.5 megabytes of disk space and can be run on a standard personal computer.
sentences.chinese: 这个程序占用2.5 兆字节的磁盘空间，可以在标准个人电脑上运行。

detailed_translations.english: (<英> disc)a small flat piece of plastic or metal which is used for storing computer or electronic information

sentences.english: Hugh’s jacket was old and shabby.
sentences.chinese: 休的夹克衫又旧又破。

sentences.english: a shabby little restaurant
sentences.chinese: 一家肮脏的小餐馆

sentences.english: a shabby tramp
sentences.chinese: 一个衣衫褴褛的流浪汉

detailed_translations.english: shabby clothes, places, or objects are untidy and in bad condition because they have been used for a long time

sentences.english: We were taught how to curtsy to the Queen.
sentences.chinese: 有人教我们如何向女王行屈膝礼。

sentences.english: She gave a curtsy.
sentences.chinese: 她行了个屈膝礼。

detailed_translations.english: if a woman curtsies, she bends her knees with one foot in front of the other as a sign of respect for an important person
Curtsy is also a noun

name: shilling
trans: 先令（1971年以前的英国货币单位，旧币的12便士）

sentences.english: The prominent coin was called the shilling and it was a silver coin.
sentences.chinese: 那种著名的硬币名叫先令,并且它是一种银质的硬币。

sentences.english: We wanted this to be a twenty shilling coin but now in the market it's trading at twenty-one.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望它是一个值二十先令的硬币,但现在它在市场上以二十一个先令的价值来交换。

sentences.english: Walter Scott wanted to give him a six penny piece to reward him for this service; but not finding any in his purse he presented him with a shilling saying, "You will owe me six pence, my good fellow.
sentences.chinese: 沃尔特•司各脱想奖赏给他一枚六便士的硬币,但他在钱包里找不到便士,于是他给了他一个先令,说:"你将欠我六便士,我亲爱的朋友.

detailed_translations.english: an old British coin or unit of money. There were 20 shillings in one pound.

sentences.english: His headmaster agreed to act as his referee.
sentences.chinese: 他的校长同意做他的推荐人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who makes sure that the rules of a sport such as football,  basketball  , or  boxing  , are followed
to be the referee of a game

sentences.english: She admitted that she was unable to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 她承认自己无法作出妥协。

detailed_translations.chinese: 妥协； 危及； 放弃
detailed_translations.english: to reach an agreement in which everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first
an agreement that is achieved after everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first, or the act of making this agreement

sentences.english: The weather has been really horrible all week.
sentences.chinese: 整个星期天气都很糟。

sentences.english: a horrible smell
sentences.chinese: 极难闻的气味

sentences.english: The food looked horrible, but it tasted OK.
sentences.chinese: 那食物看上去很糟，可吃起来还不错。

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人恐惧的， 可怕的； 骇人听闻的； 极讨厌的， 使人不愉快的； 糟透的
detailed_translations.english: very bad - used, for example, about things you see, taste, or smell, or about the weather

name: laundry
trans: （待洗的或洗好的）衣服；洗衣店；洗衣房

sentences.english: She did the laundry (= washed the clothes etc ) and hung it out to dry.
sentences.chinese: 她洗了衣服，然后挂出去晾干。

sentences.english: a pile of dirty laundry
sentences.chinese: 一堆待洗的脏衣服

detailed_translations.english: clothes, sheets etc that need to be washed or have just been washed

sentences.english: Clean out the bathtub when you are done.
sentences.chinese: 洗完澡后请把浴缸洗干净。

sentences.english: His students are generally much better at bathtub dynamics by the end of his course, which gives him hope.
sentences.chinese: 在完成他的课程之后，他的学生对浴缸动力学的理解普遍好多了，这给了他希望。

sentences.english: And the neighbor down the street found in the bathtub… And the kid who ran his motorcycle into a tree an accident but for the note left behind saying that's exactly what he intended to do… And so on.
sentences.chinese: 还有那个街上的邻居，被人发现在浴缸里自杀了……还记着有个小年轻骑摩托车撞到了树上，大家认为这是个意外，但是这个小孩留的字条上说他是一心寻死的，等等。

detailed_translations.english: a long large container that you fill with water and sit or lie in to wash yourself

sentences.english: He began sobbing uncontrollably .
sentences.chinese: 他不由自主地抽噎起来。

sentences.english: Her sobs grew louder.
sentences.chinese: 她的呜咽声变得更大了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 啜泣，呜咽；（风等）发出呜咽声
detailed_translations.english: to cry noisily while breathing in short sudden bursts
A sob is one of the noises that you make when you are crying

sentences.english: The skirt was too big around the waist.
sentences.chinese: 那条裙子腰围太大。

detailed_translations.english: the narrow part in the middle of the human body

sentences.english: a bulletproof vest
sentences.chinese: 防弹背心

detailed_translations.english: a piece of underwear without sleeves that you wear on the top half of your body

name: disgusting
trans: 使人反感的；令人厌恶的

sentences.english: Rubbish was piled everywhere – it was disgusting.
sentences.chinese: 垃圾堆得到处都是，很恶心。

sentences.english: Smoking is a really disgusting habit.
sentences.chinese: 吸烟是一种十分令人讨厌的习惯。

detailed_translations.english: extremely unpleasant and making you feel sick

sentences.english: So on this solemn day, at this sacred hour, once more we pause.
sentences.chinese: 在这庄严的日子，在这个神圣的时刻，让我们再一次停顿一下。

sentences.english: At this moment, in this election, we must pledge once more to march into the future.
sentences.chinese: 在这一时刻，在这次选举中，我们必须再一次保证，向未来挺进。

sentences.english: Today that dream has not vanished altogether, but the single market is under threat once more.
sentences.chinese: 今天，这一梦想尚未完全消失，但统一市场却再一次处于威胁之中。

sentences.english: If so, your wardrobe may be in need of editing.
sentences.chinese: 假如是，那么你的衣橱就需要整理了。

sentences.english: It connects those who want to give with those in need of receiving.
sentences.chinese: 它帮助那些希望捐赠的人和需要赠品的人取得联系。

sentences.english: If you keep cutting yourself off from opening up to others, you risk not sharing your skills, talents, and abilities with others in need of help.
sentences.chinese: 如果你始终拒绝向他人敞开心怀，在需要帮助时就可能出现不与他人分享你的技能、才智和能力的问题。

sentences.english: This is a book I heartily recommend to all hill walkers.
sentences.chinese: 我向所有山区健行者大力推荐这本书。

sentences.english: Our room overlooks the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 我们的房间可以俯视大海。

sentences.english: It is easy to overlook a small detail like that.
sentences.chinese: 那样的小细节很容易被忽略。

sentences.english: She found him entertaining enough to overlook his faults.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得他很有趣，足以让她包容他的缺点。

detailed_translations.english: if a house, room etc overlooks something, it has a view of it, usually from above

sentences.english: The modern Russian alphabet has 31 letters.
sentences.chinese: 现代俄语字母表有31个字母。

detailed_translations.english: a set of letters, arranged in a particular order, and used in writing

sentences.english: The cheaper drugs are just as effective in treating arthritis.
sentences.chinese: 较便宜的药品对治疗关节炎同样有效。

sentences.english: the painting’s highly effective use of colour
sentences.chinese: 绘画中得心应手的色彩运用

sentences.english: Training is often much less effective than expected.
sentences.chinese: 训练的效果往往远低于预期。

sentences.english: the most effective ways of reducing inner city congestion
sentences.chinese: 减少旧城区交通拥挤最有效的办法

detailed_translations.english: successful, and working in the way that was intended

sentences.english: the fading evening light
sentences.chinese: 渐暗的暮色

sentences.english: a pair of faded jeans
sentences.chinese: 一条褪了色的牛仔裤

sentences.english: The sun had faded the curtains.
sentences.chinese: 太阳把窗帘晒得褪了色。

detailed_translations.english: to lose colour and brightness, or to make something do this

sentences.english: He slid a control to fade out the music.
sentences.chinese: 他滑动控制器，让音乐声渐渐减弱。

sentences.english: He was too far away to be able to identify faces.
sentences.chinese: 他离得太远，没法看面孔认出谁是谁。

sentences.english: The police took fingerprints and identified the body.
sentences.chinese: 警方采集了指纹，对尸体作了身份确认。

detailed_translations.english: to recognize and correctly name someone or something

sentences.english: An alternative route is along the Via Unione.
sentences.chinese: 另一条路线是沿着联合路走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 两者选一的， 供选择的； 另类的
detailed_translations.english: an alternative idea, plan etc is different from the one you have and can be used instead

detailed_translations.chinese: 替换物，选择；选择的自由
detailed_translations.english: something you can choose to do or use instead of something else

sentences.english: He specializes in archaeology.
sentences.chinese: 他专修考古学。

sentences.english: In my recent research, I found that all three come together and, what is more, they help me to show that archaeology has relevance – it is not just old stones and bones.
sentences.chinese: 我在最近的研究中发现，这三点综合发生着作用，除此之外，它们也帮助我发现考古学的重要意义，它不仅仅意味着一堆石头和骨头。

sentences.english: "There was no access to clean water, there was no access to basic education especially in the rural areas where the archaeology was," she says.
sentences.chinese: 在那里的考古学特别是农村地区，我们并没有获得干净的水，有没有基本的教育的机会，“她说。

detailed_translations.english: the study of ancient societies by examining what remains of their buildings,  grave s  , tools etc

name: archaeological
trans: 考古学的；与考古学有关的 (<美>archeological)

sentences.english: Just who made the tools is unclear from the archaeological evidence alone, though our relative Homo erectus is identified as the likely creator of at least the Acheulian tools.
sentences.chinese: 尽管已经确定我们的近亲直立人至少是阿舍利工具可能的创造者，但仅凭考古学证据还无法确定是谁制造了这些工具。

sentences.english: So there are two other models, then, models different from the immigration model, two other models for understanding the formation of Israel, that build on this archaeological evidence.
sentences.chinese: 那么还有两个其他的模型，与移民模型不同的两个模型，这两个模型也是为了说明以色列的形成，它们是依据考古学证据。

sentences.english: The work fills (in) a gap which has hitherto existed in our archaeological literature.
sentences.chinese: 这部著作填补了我国考古学文献中的一个空白。

sentences.english: In fact, she was an archaeologist.
sentences.chinese: 其实她是一个考古学家。

sentences.english: But I do not believe, as a field archaeologist, that we can use the scientific method to prove or disprove [them].
sentences.chinese: 但作为一个在现场工作的考古学家，我不相信我们能用科学手段对它们进行证实或证伪”。

sentences.english: people dying of starvation
sentences.chinese: 快饿死的人们

detailed_translations.english: suffering or death caused by lack of food

sentences.english: I passed on my tentative conclusions to the police.
sentences.chinese: 我把我的初步结论递交给了警方。

sentences.english: The government is taking tentative steps towards tackling the country’s economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 政府正在采取临时性措施来解决国家的经济问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 试验性的，暂定的；踌躇的
detailed_translations.english: not definite or certain, and may be changed later

sentences.english: He passes the ball with unerring accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 他传球准确无误。

sentences.english: They questioned the accuracy of the information in the file.
sentences.chinese: 他们怀疑档案中信息的正确性。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being exact or correct; the ability to do sth skilfully without making mistakes

sentences.english: Schliemann excavated the ancient city of Troy.
sentences.chinese: 谢里曼发掘出特洛伊古城。

detailed_translations.english: if a scientist or archaeologist excavates an area of land, they dig carefully to find ancient objects, bones etc

sentences.english: A second excavation, in 1985, lasted a year and was cut short for technical reasons.
sentences.chinese: 第二次挖掘是在1985年，因为技术原因持续了一年就突然停止了。

sentences.english: If he thinks I’m particular about excavation records, you should see him taking pictures!
sentences.chinese: 如果他觉得我对挖掘纪录很挑剔，你应该看看他是怎么拍照的。

sentences.english: Blue flags define the excavation perimeter, while yellow ones mark the location of fossils or stone tools.
sentences.chinese: 蓝旗用来显示发掘地的周长，而黄旗用来标明发掘出化石或石制工具的地点。

name: interrupt
trans: 打断……讲话；打岔；暂时中断或中止

sentences.english: Will you stop interrupting me!
sentences.chinese: 别打断我的话！

sentences.english: Sorry to interrupt, but I need to ask you to come downstairs.
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉打扰了，我得请你下楼来。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from continuing what they are saying or doing by suddenly speaking to them, making a noise etc

name: acute
trans: 深刻的；敏锐的；强烈的，剧烈的

sentences.english: Young children have a particularly acute sense of smell.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿的嗅觉特别灵敏。

detailed_translations.english: acute senses such as hearing, taste, touch etc are very good and sensitive

sentences.english: I think we can safely assume (=  it is almost certain  ) that interest rates will go up again soon.
sentences.chinese: 我想我们几乎可以肯定，利率很快会再次上调。

sentences.english: When it got to midnight and Paul was still not back, I began to assume the worst (=  think that the worst possible thing had happened  ) .
sentences.chinese: 到午夜时保罗还没回来，我就开始往最坏的地方想了。

sentences.english: Whoever they appoint will assume responsibility for all financial matters.
sentences.chinese: 不管他们任命的是谁，他都要负责财务方面的所有事务。

sentences.english: These relationships assume great importance in times of crisis.
sentences.chinese: 在危急时刻，这些关系显得尤为重要。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is true, although you do not have definite proof

sentences.english: Despite her recent surgery she has been carrying on regardless.
sentences.chinese: 尽管她最近动了手术，她却一直在不顾一切地继续工作。

detailed_translations.english: without being affected or influenced by something

sentences.english: Every problem you have is your responsibility, regardless of who caused it.
sentences.chinese: 不管是谁造成的，你都需要对你面对的每个问题负全责。

sentences.english: The fields give high and stable yields regardless of climatic circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 不管天气条件如何， 这块地总是保持稳产高产。

sentences.english: The new tax laws were rammed through regardless of the opposition of the majority of the people.
sentences.chinese: 不顾大多数人民的反对，新的税法强行通过了。

sentences.english: Wipe your feet on the mat.
sentences.chinese: 在地垫上蹭蹭你的鞋底。

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of thick rough material which covers part of a floor
to tangle or weave or become tangled or woven into a dense mass

sentences.english: ...an old patchwork quilt.
sentences.chinese: …一条旧的拼布被子。

sentences.english: Maggie knows how to quilt.
sentences.chinese: 玛吉知道怎样缝被子。

sentences.english: Quilting a bed cover can be laborious.
sentences.chinese: 缝制一个床罩会很费力的。

detailed_translations.english: a warm thick cover for a bed, made by sewing two layers of cloth together, with feathers or a thick material in between them
If you quilt, or if you quilt a piece of fabric, you make a quilt

sentences.english: ...the threats our ancestors faced from wild beasts.
sentences.chinese: …我们祖辈所面临的来自野兽的威胁。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, especially a large or dangerous one

sentences.english: I do it for maybe an hour at most.
sentences.chinese: 我或许在沙滩上最多呆一个钟头。

sentences.english: ...a tiny fossil plant, only a few centimetres high.
sentences.chinese: …一块小小的植物化石，只有几厘米高。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring length. There are 100 centimetres in one metre.

sentences.english: Her gaze sharpened, as if she had seen something unusual.
sentences.chinese: 她眼睛一亮，好像看到了不寻常的东西。
